src:
Leicester moves 3rd in Premier League with 2-0 win at Palace
03 Nov 2019, 08:16 by The Associated Press



Leicester City’s Harvey Barnes, left, and Crystal Palace’s Joel Ward battle for the ball during the English Premier League soccer match at Selhurst Park, London, Sunday Nov. 3, 2019. (John Walton/PA via AP)



Leicester City’s Wilfred Ndidi, left, and Crystal Palace’s Jordan Ayew battle for the ball during the English Premier League soccer match at Selhurst Park, London, Sunday Nov. 3, 2019. (John Walton/PA via AP)



Leicester City’s Ben Chilwell, left, and Crystal Palace’s Jordan Ayew battle for the ball during the English Premier League soccer match at Selhurst Park, London, Sunday Nov. 3, 2019. (John Walton/PA via AP)



Crystal Palace’s Wilfried Zaha, left, breaks from Leicester City’s Youri Tielemans during the English Premier League soccer match at Selhurst Park, London, Sunday Nov. 3, 2019. (John Walton/PA via AP)


LONDON (AP) — Jamie Vardy scored late to take Leicester third in the Premier League by sealing a 2-0 win at Crystal Palace on Sunday.
Turkish defender Caglar Söyüncü opened the scoring with his first goal in the league in the 57th minute, when he was left free to head in after a deflected corner.
Vardy sealed the result in the 88th after a fine combination with Demarai Gray.
Palace failed to register an effort on target in the first half, and only marginaly improved in the second.
Leicester moved ahead of Chelsea on goal difference, two points behind Manchester City and eight behind league leader Liverpool after 11 games.
Palace dropped to ninth.
Everton was hosting Tottenham in the late game.
___
More AP soccer: https://apnews.com/Soccer and https://twitter.com/AP_Sports
The Associated Press
